## Learning and Teaching Methods

*Optional - taken from PIP*

```{r setup-gt, include=FALSE}
library(gt)

# Another option for making tables...
make_gt_table <- function(df) {
  gt(df) %>%
    #tab_header(title = "Learning and Teaching Methods") %>%
    sub_missing(
      columns = everything(),
      missing_text = "Not Applicable"
    ) %>%
    cols_align(
      align = "left",
      columns = 1   # first column (Method)
    ) %>% 
    cols_align(
      align = "right",
      columns = 2:3 # second and third columns (numbers)
    ) %>% 
    cols_width(
      everything() ~ gt::pct(30)
    ) %>% 
    tab_style(
      style = cell_text(weight = "bold"), 
      locations = cells_column_labels(everything())
    )
}

```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
methods <- data.frame(
  Method = c("Seminar", "Practical Classes and Workshops", "Guided Independent Study"),
  `Formal Contact Hours` = c(10, 20, NA),
  `Notional Learning Hours (including formal contact hours)` = c(10, 20, 64),
  check.names = FALSE
)
make_gt_table(methods)
```
